title: Welcome!
text:
Hi! I am Andreas Gammelgaard Damsbo. I am a medical doctor and PhD-student at the Danish Stroke Centre, Aarhus University Hospital and Aarhus University.
This page is my professional website, where I will write about the research and other projects I am engaged with through my work. Don’t hesitate to contact me if you want to collaborate or want to share your thoughts on some of my work.
I also do other things than work, which I might link to.
Take care!

title: Project: Foot database
text:
This project is the most comprehensive data base migration yet.
The client’s wish, was for an old Microsoft Access data base to be migrated to REDCap, for continous use and data collection.

title: Project: Foot database
text:

title: Project: Foot database
text:
Database
Here are a few characteristics:

Around 3000 entries
5 collection instruments, 4 of them were to be used as repeatable instruments.
80 variables

title: Project: Foot database
text:
Coding
I have collected my scripts in a repository, which will be made public when I have finished the work.

title: Research results
text:
Here I will try to write about the research I am involved with. All of this work have been in corporation with my great colleagues and supervisors to who I am very grateful.
I will also be writing about work and projects in R.

title: ESOC 2023: Predicting physical activity level after stroke

More is coming



More will be added before ESOC 2023

title: ESOC 2023: Predicting physical activity level after stroke
text:
Intro
I am presenting a poster at European Stroke Organisation Conference 2023 on predicting changes in physical activity after stroke.
The poster will be part of the poster viewing programme on Wednesday, May 24 2023.

title: ESOC 2023: Predicting physical activity level after stroke
text:
Background
We have been interested in trying to predict patients at increased risk of physical activity decline after stroke.






Non-published results



Please note, that tables and figures presented here are not yet published, certainly not peer-reviewed, and definitely subject to change.

title: ESOC 2023: Predicting physical activity level after stroke
text:
About the poster
I wanted to divert from the traditional text heavy poster format. For the session at ESOC, I will be at the poster stand for most of the time to talk about our work. THe abstract will be available for download for the participants.
The poster is created in PowerPoint, as this was where I had an available template. The template was later abandoned though.
The fonts are Alice and Jost*. Both are open source and free to use.
The icons are from the Material Design Icons, and also open source.

title: Health Data projects
text:
During my work in clinical research I have acquired a special set of skills in working with data collection, data bases and data analysis. I am very much interested in sharing these skils and knowledge.
I am primarily working with R and REDCap. I have published one R package to CRAN and am actively maintaining two other packages on GitHub (on is on its way to CRAN). I am also working on a handbook for clinical researchers on working with R and REDCap.
I have worked as a data science consultant on a few projects. Here I will also share a few of them as a portfolio. Please don’t hesitate to contact me if you need help on a project.
